11.4K/04 TD Cr2X30T,Dr1X30t

 

 

t/c out



MV. HOPE

Built : 2005 , Japan, IMABARI Shipyard, Japan.

Type : Bulk Carrier

DWT Summer SW 53,474 mt @ 12.303 m extreme / tpc 55.30 mt/cm

DWT Winter SW 52,063 mt @ 12.047 m extreme

DWT Tropical SW 54,892 mt @ 12.559 m extreme

GT/RT (International 1969) : 30,002/18,486

LOA/LBP 189.94 m. / 182.00 m Breadth (moulded) 32.26 m. Depth (moulded) – 17.30 m.

Suez Canal : 31,129,20 / 28,617.44 / Panama Canal NT : 24,902

Speed/Consumption at Sea

BALLAST - Abt 14.5 knots on abt 31.8mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.1mts ULSMGO

LADEN - Abt 14 knots on abt 29.5mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.1mts ULSMGO

ECO Without Guarantee

BALLAST - Abt 13.5 knots on abt 26.5mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.1mts ULSMGO

LADEN - Abt 13.5 knots on abt 30.5mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.1mts ULSMGO

5 holds/5 hatches

Hatch covers: 4 panels per hatch end folding type, double skin - hydraulic cylinder operated.

Hatch opening – 21.12 m. (L) x 17.60 m. (W), ALL HATCHES

Holds tank-top dimensions, minimums excluding lower stools, bulkhead corrugations etc (approx only wog)

Hold #1) Length 29.0 m, x 19,00 m x 19.30 M MIN 29.00 x 30.50 x 19.30 M MAX

Hold #2/3/4) 29.00 M x 32.26 M x 17.50 M MAX, MIN 29.00 M x 23.90 M 17.50 M
Hold #5) MAX 29.80 M x 32.26 m x 17.50 m Min 29.00m x 19.40m x 17.50 m

Electro/hydraulic deck Cranes : 4 x 30 .5 mt SWL

Working radius at swl 30.5mt 26 mtrs , Maximum clear outreach 9.87mtrs.

Cranes capable of use in grab operation When cranes on grab or on skip/bucket duty maximum gross lifting limited to 24mt (ttl weight of grab or skip/bucket and cargo).

No more than 1 ship's crane to be worked simultaneously at a hatch. Owners will not supply crane men from Crew.

Vessel's cranes designed and class approved to operate within the designated capacities/parameters (for further details

refer to makers' instruction manual) only in a harbour or sheltered waters environment with no significant movement of the ship due to wave action, nor any relative movement between crane/grab and cargo if loading/discharging into/from barges, transhipment or similar environmental conditions to be less than Beauport force 2 , sea state 1.-

Ambient temperature for Cranes operation: -10degrees C to +40degrees C.

Grabs : 4 x 12 cbm

Type: “Hook –on “/ “Radio-controlled”, Opening single rope

Maker: Tobu Jukogyo Co.Ltd, Model RSHC-120 /60x3

Volume capacity: 12/6 cbm cargo density 1/1.87 mt/cbm

Grabs suitable only for cargoes with material grain size from min 2mm to max 50mm. When cranes on grab duty

maximum gross lifting limited to 24,00mt (ttl weight of grab and cargo).

When the vessel calls at port or terminal where required mooring ropes in addition and/or of different specification

from what the vessel has onboard to be supplied and/or hired at chrtrs’ cost time

Tank capacities:

-abt 1,934,45 mt VLSFO (excl serv/settl tanks), bss 90% full and SG of fuel 0.95

-abt 314 mt ( 388m3) ULSMGO ( exclserv/settl tanks) , bss 90% full and SG of ULSMGO 0.86

Ballast capacity excluding No 3 floodable hold – abt 14,570 cu.m.

Ballast capacity of No. 3 Hold – abt 14,103,43 cu.m.

FW capacity: abt 408.04 cu m.

Constants : abt 380 mts excl. fresh water / unpumpables

Uniform Strengths: (Homogeneous type of cargo loading conditions)

Tanktops local strength:

Hold #1 21.43 mt/sq.m.

Hold #2 18.00 mt/sq.m,

Hold #3 23.50 mt/sq.m,

Hold #4 18.00 mt/sq.m,

Hold #5 21.00 mt/sq.m.

Bulk cargoes to have maximum Specific Gravity of 2.11 metric tons per cubic meter.

M/Deck 2.50 mt/sq.m (excluding cross-decks)

Hatch Cover 1- 2.08 mt/sq.m.

Hatch Covers 2 to 5 - 1.75 mt/sq.m

Other fittings:

Natural ventilation yes

Cement holes per hold: 2 (diameter: 600 mm)

Aussie hold ladder fitted

No. 3 hold can be ballasted

For all steel products and steel coil loading owners to be contacted for approval with regards to vessel's strength,

intake, and final stowage plan. No California (vertical) block stow for Steel Plates/Slabs etc.

All details about, given in good faith and without guarantee.

Vessel burns ULSMGO when maneuvering, in confined waters and for starting d/gens or low load.

Speed and consumption figures basis up to summer draft, even keel (for laden passages) good weather conditions up to max Beaufort 4, and/or significant wave height up to 1.25mtrs and no adverse influence of currents, the first 24 hours and last 24 hours of any sea passage being excluded, also excluding periods with reduction of speed, in straits, in tidal affected waters, high risk piracy areas, due to reasons of safety/visibility or on charterers’ orders.

For ballast exchange programs and ballast/de ballast floodable hold, the vessel has the liberty of slow steaming or

stopping or being idle if required. Cost of ballast treatment if required and any loss of speed / time to be for

charterers account.

The warranted speeds and consumptions are on an average of the performance results of each passage over the entire Charter period.

Any savings in fuel consumption to be set off against any loss of time and vice versa.

Consumption in port:

When idle - about 2.5 tonnes VLSFO

When working – about 5.50 tonnes VLSFO (basis 24 hrs working)

Fuel Quality

Charterers undertake to supply only fuel and diesel/gasoil complying with current ISO specifications at the time of supply.

VLSFO - 380 Centistoke ISO 8217:2017 (E) RMG 380 with max sulphur 0.50% Ultra Low Sulphur Marine Gas Oil (ULSMGO)

with max sulphur 0.10% grade DMA 8217:2017 Min FIA/100 20 ECN (IP541). VLSFO purchased/supplied in different lots must be segregated.

All Fuel shall consist of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum sources and shall not contain any anomalous components (such as Tall Oil and/or Inorganic Acid Substances) and to be of a stable and homogenous nature.

Fuel has to be free of waste lubricants, chemicals and chemical wastes. Cold flow characteristics of the fuel should be such that paraffin precipitation does not hinder operability of fuel system components. The fuel shall comply with the specifications of ISO 8217 Table 1 or 2 and to Clause 5 and the Revised Annex VI regulation 18.3. During bunkering, bunker suppliers to comply with reg 18 of Marpol Annex VI and the guidelines set out in IMO res Mepc.182(59) guidelines for representative drip samples to be drawn from ship’s manifold.

Seller/Supplier warrants that (i) the products being supplied and barges nominated in this Order are not designated in any sanctions list issued by the UN, US or EU and (ii) is not owned or controlled by any person or entity registered in or operating from Iran, or designated in any sanctions issued by the UN, US or EU.

Bunker specifications to conform with any local and/or state and/or international regulations prevailing at any areas,

ports and/or places vessel calls/sails.

CUBIC CAPACITIES: Total 68,927.4 CBM grain, 65,526.1 CBM bale

(Note: above bale capacity is calculated basis of 600 x 600 x 600 mm bale cargo)

ADA

 

MV. ROSE

47,305 DWT ON 11.769M DRAFT SSW TPC 51.4

KOREA FLAG - OITA JAPAN 2002 BLT CLASS KR 

LOA/LBP/BEAM 189.9/181.0/31.0 M

GT/NT 27,306/ 15,810

5/5 HO/HA

GRAIN/BALE : 60,769.9 CBM or 2,145,996 CFT / 58,785 CBM

CYLINDER FOLDING TYPE HATCH COVERS – (MACGREGOR–KAYABA)

4 X 30 MT CRANES

SPEED/CONS :

ABT 13 KNOTS(B)/12 KNOTS(L) WITH OR WITHOUT FAVORABLE CURRENTS ON ABT 22.5 MTS(B) LSFO/23.5 MTS(L) LSFO + ABT 0.20 MTS LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT ON AN EVEN KEEL CONDITION AND UNDER GOOD WEATHER CONDITIONS OF WINDS NOT EXCEEDING BEAUFORT SCALE FORCE 3, AND COMBINED SEA AND SWELL CONDITION NOT EXCEEDING 1.25 METERS – WITH NO ADVERSE CURRENTS OR NEGATIVE INFLUENCE OF SWELL.

AT SEA VESSEL CONSUMES ADDITIONAL 1.5 MTS LSFO FOR THE DIESEL GENERATORS AND WHEN PUMPING OUT CARGO HOLD BILGE WATER OR EXCHANGE BALLAST WATER VESSEL CONSUMES ADDITIONAL LMGO

IN PORT : IDLE : ABT 2.5 MTS LSFO 380 CST OR LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT + 0.20 MTS LSMGO 0,1% SULPHUR CONTENT + BOILER ABT 1 MTS LSFO 380 CST OR LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT

WORKING : ABT 3.5 MTS MTS LSFO 380 CST OR LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT + 0.20 MTS LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT + BOILER ABT 1 MTS LSFO 380 CST OR LSMGO 0.1% SULPHUR CONTENT

WHILST MANOUEVERING/NAVIGATING IN SHALLOW WATERS, CROSSING CANALS, NARROW STRAITS...ETC.. VESSEL CONSUMES MGO INSTEAD OF LSFO.

BUNKER SPECS:

FUEL GRADE: LSFO 380CST RMG / LSMGO DMA

LSFO (S < 0.5%) AND LSMGO(S<0.1%): ISO 8217:2017 or 2010

VISTCOSITY FOR LSFO TO BE OVER 30

BUNKERING IS NOT ALLOWED IN ANY CIS PORTS.

ADA
